page.title: 07TRANSPORT:CAR AND BUS.
page.content: It is estimated that car-ownership in this block is between 50-55%.In the 30-50 year age group the estimated percentage rises to 60%.The average mileage per week is approximately 150. Bus travel is the most significant mode of transport in the Colne Valley generally.There are three Kirklees bus services running through the block on a year-round basis:_the 353 HillTop to Huddersfield route,the 347/8 Wilberlee to Huddersfield route and the 373 Pole Moor to Almondbury route which runs just five times a day. 325 people a day board at Wilberlee and HillTop;175 on Sundays.Buses run every hour from 0644 and 0730 respect -ively, linking in with the key A62 Marsden/Huddersfield via Slaithwaite service running every 15 minutes.1000 people board in Slaithwaite daily.Cost is 60p.Offpeak and weekends cost 30p.
